alert.note: Alert for Eureka (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 12:18AM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Nevada, including the following county, Eureka. * WHEN...Until 230 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1218 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Portions of State Route 278 . Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Portions of State Route 278 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Garden Pass. and State Route 278 from Garden Pass to just south of Pine Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
